ResilientHomes aims to create a structured, transparent, and efficient housing recovery ecosystem after disasters.

  • Citizens can easily submit aid or housing assistance requests via a self-service portal or mobile app, with options to upload damage evidence and location coordinates.
  • Automated verification workflows validate identity and damage claims, routing them to the right government or NGO department.
  • Task assignments help field officers conduct on-site inspections, while dashboards track funds released, repairs completed, and households rehabilitated.
  • Transparency builds public trust and accelerates recovery, while data-driven insights help agencies identify high-impact zones and plan future resilience measures.
x_snc_hack4good_0_hack4good_proposal.problem_statement: After floods, earthquakes, or cyclones, thousands of families lose their homes and livelihoods. Relief aid often arrives in silos — multiple agencies collect duplicate data, causing delays and uneven resource allocation. Families struggle to track their applications for housing reconstruction or financial support. Governments and NGOs lack a transparent, centralized view of progress and accountability.
